HDG.LOG.content: categories make safekeeping not seem like a gathering
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: categories make safekeeping not seem like a gathering

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger on movedness (Bewegtheit), central to Aristotle’s Physics, but not in Kant’s table of categories: Kant didn’t unfold relation of movedness to being
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger on movedness (Bewegtheit), central to Aristotle’s Physics, but not in Kant’s table of categories: Kant didn’t unfold relation of movedness to being

HDG.FS.content: Hegel’s Logic presents God’s thought before creation [?] > “creation” as production (Herstellung) of world > via Aristotle, before creation, God thinks eidos of world, totality of categories: Hegel’s ontology presents ontology from which God takes measure of his creation (Kant’s intuitus originarius)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Hegel’s Logic presents God’s thought before creation [?] > “creation” as production (Herstellung) of world > via Aristotle, before creation, God thinks eidos of world, totality of categories: Hegel’s ontology presents ontology from which God takes measure of his creation (Kant’s intuitus originarius)

HDG.FS.content: Kantian “Copernican revolution”: the thing is adjusted in advance to power of knowing, category “substance” brings manifold of hyletic data into definite form, object posited as synthesis of intuition/concept > for Kant, knowledge = bringing-into-form (accomplished by understanding)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Kantian “Copernican revolution”: the thing is adjusted in advance to power of knowing, category “substance” brings manifold of hyletic data into definite form, object posited as synthesis of intuition/concept > for Kant, knowledge = bringing-into-form (accomplished by understanding)

HDG.FS.content: Husserl attempts to articulate what Kant simply characterizes as concept of form: thus the given (Gegebenen) of intuition, categorial intuition, category more than a form > categorial as given
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Husserl attempts to articulate what Kant simply characterizes as concept of form: thus the given (Gegebenen) of intuition, categorial intuition, category more than a form > categorial as given

HDG.FS.content: for Husserl, the categorial, the forms, the “is” can be encountered (whereas, for Kant, they’re just deduced from table of judgment), the fact (Tatsache) of the category can be encountered (vorfinden)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: for Husserl, the categorial, the forms, the “is” can be encountered (whereas, for Kant, they’re just deduced from table of judgment), the fact (Tatsache) of the category can be encountered (vorfinden)

HDG.FS.content: to unfold question of meaning of Being, Being must be given > Husserl succeeded in this making present of Being, phenomenally present in category > Husserl gave Heidegger ground: “being” no mere concept, no pure abstraction > Husserl doesn’t inquire forth into Being after reaching Being as given, doesn’t ask what it means > no question for Husserl, “being” means being-object (but objectivity is a mode of presence)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: to unfold question of meaning of Being, Being must be given > Husserl succeeded in this making present of Being, phenomenally present in category > Husserl gave Heidegger ground: “being” no mere concept, no pure abstraction > Husserl doesn’t inquire forth into Being after reaching Being as given, doesn’t ask what it means > no question for Husserl, “being” means being-object (but objectivity is a mode of presence)

HDG.FS.content: when Heidegger looks at inkwell, does so w/out reference to hyletic data and categories, he undergoes fundamental experience w/ thing itself [outside consciousness but still moral image of thought?] > “being” in Da-sein says being-outside-of [vs. being in of consciousness], must preserve an “outside,” thus ek-stasis > Dasein rigorously means: ek-statically being there (immanence is broken) > from ek-stasis to instancy in the clearing (Inständigkeit in der Lichtung) [the turn?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: when Heidegger looks at inkwell, does so w/out reference to hyletic data and categories, he undergoes fundamental experience w/ thing itself [outside consciousness but still moral image of thought?] > “being” in Da-sein says being-outside-of [vs. being in of consciousness], must preserve an “outside,” thus ek-stasis > Dasein rigorously means: ek-statically being there (immanence is broken) > from ek-stasis to instancy in the clearing (Inständigkeit in der Lichtung) [the turn?]

HDG.OHF.content: grasp facticity w/ view to primordiality followed to the end > must be wide awake for specific categories of Dasein, must be brought into view in public manner (having-been-interpreted in the today)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: grasp facticity w/ view to primordiality followed to the end > must be wide awake for specific categories of Dasein, must be brought into view in public manner (having-been-interpreted in the today)

HDG.OHF.content: [method: summary of how to hermeneut “today”] today only fully defined in ontological character as a how of facticity (existence) when we make visible “temporality” (existential not category) as fundamental phenomenon of facticity
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [method: summary of how to hermeneut “today”] today only fully defined in ontological character as a how of facticity (existence) when we make visible “temporality” (existential not category) as fundamental phenomenon of facticity

HDG.OHF.content: categories are haphazardly employed (from disparate sources) to characterize the basis (Boden) from out of which classifying begins to run its course (seinen Gang nimmt) > “that the Ausgangsverhalten is unworried (Unbekümmertheit) [since worry is there in opening to phenomenological hermeneutics] about its own concrete and precise clarification when the classifying and filing away is being done” “is only a symptom of the fact that its objects are ‘only’ material for a typology and system of classification” > idea of knowledge pursued (angestrebte) here, already sketched out in advance (schon vorgezeichnet) [goes on to describe static system, structuralism even]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: categories are haphazardly employed (from disparate sources) to characterize the basis (Boden) from out of which classifying begins to run its course (seinen Gang nimmt) > “that the Ausgangsverhalten is unworried (Unbekümmertheit) [since worry is there in opening to phenomenological hermeneutics] about its own concrete and precise clarification when the classifying and filing away is being done” “is only a symptom of the fact that its objects are ‘only’ material for a typology and system of classification” > idea of knowledge pursued (angestrebte) here, already sketched out in advance (schon vorgezeichnet) [goes on to describe static system, structuralism even]

HDG.OHF.content: Husserl’s object didn’t change, but the how of interrogating/defining it did, question of access (Zugangsfrage): a descriptive method (not a constructivist one) > “phenomenon” not primarily a category, but deals w/ how of access/grasping/safekeeping (Verwahrung), phenomenology (initially) nothing more than mode of research/inquiry (Weise der Forschung): “addressing (Ansprechen) something just as it shows (zeigt) itself and only to the extent that it shows itself”
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Husserl’s object didn’t change, but the how of interrogating/defining it did, question of access (Zugangsfrage): a descriptive method (not a constructivist one) > “phenomenon” not primarily a category, but deals w/ how of access/grasping/safekeeping (Verwahrung), phenomenology (initially) nothing more than mode of research/inquiry (Weise der Forschung): “addressing (Ansprechen) something just as it shows (zeigt) itself and only to the extent that it shows itself”

HDG.OHF.content: as-what & How of the world’s being-encountered (Begegnens) lie in significance (Bedeutsamkeit), significance not a category of things but the categorial dimension of being-there > being of world & human life both designated by term Dasein > on basis of factical spatiality we can define ontological meaning of being “in” the environs (Umhaften) of world > “being” that encounters world as Weltdasein, characterized by caring, fundamental mode of being, it “is” its world, the very world it has encountered [hermeneutic circle]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: as-what & How of the world’s being-encountered (Begegnens) lie in significance (Bedeutsamkeit), significance not a category of things but the categorial dimension of being-there > being of world & human life both designated by term Dasein > on basis of factical spatiality we can define ontological meaning of being “in” the environs (Umhaften) of world > “being” that encounters world as Weltdasein, characterized by caring, fundamental mode of being, it “is” its world, the very world it has encountered [hermeneutic circle]

HDG.OHF.content: difficulty of untangling context of tightly woven categories, & demonstrating it in intuition, disappears if (always anew) we “hold to the task of appropriating (aneignet) the corresponding position of looking (entsprechenden Blickstand) at it and holding out in (durchält) this looking […] i.e., staying clear of a certain sedimented customary approach” [guard against (auf der Hut ist) slipping back into it unawares (unversehens)—is Heidegger always this vigilant? is attention given to destruction or to Being?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: difficulty of untangling context of tightly woven categories, & demonstrating it in intuition, disappears if (always anew) we “hold to the task of appropriating (aneignet) the corresponding position of looking (entsprechenden Blickstand) at it and holding out in (durchält) this looking […] i.e., staying clear of a certain sedimented customary approach” [guard against (auf der Hut ist) slipping back into it unawares (unversehens)—is Heidegger always this vigilant? is attention given to destruction or to Being?]
